column4: Hi , is there a way that I can hide towards my boss to which internet sites I am surfing during office hours?
You could use a proxy server. Tor may work (but it's slow). Or if you can keep your home PC on during the day, you could use it as a proxy.
I have a server running at home could I do it with that too?
Yes.
Does it have sshd running? (openssh-server on Ubuntu or Debian.)
Does the work PC run Windows or Linux?
linux 8.04 server
Is that your server, or the work PC?
my server is at home
I am asking about your work PC.
my laptop is also on linux
*sigh* anyway, if your work PC runs Linux, then use this command: « ssh -D1080 your-home-server-address »
And once it connects, set up your web browser to use a SOCKS proxy on 127.0.0.1, like in this picture: http://sine.cluenet.org/~grawity/trash/firefox-socks-config.png
sorry just to be clear I use my laptop at work with linux and at home I have a linux server on 8.04
okay. And you use Firefox on your laptop, or some other browser?
I use firefox a slight detail not to forget that I am behinde a proxy here at work to
Can you connect with 'ssh' from work to your server?
yes I can
Good. When connecting, use « ssh -D 1080 your-server-address »
And then set up Firefox like in that image.
